name: Kimchi Fried Rice (Kimchi Bokkeumbap)
author: abstractj
summary: Tired of the same ol' fried rice? Well, this will add a kick to any of your favorite fried rice recipe by adding kimchi. If you love kimchi, you will surely love this recipe. You can substitute butter for the canola oil and any meat (chicken, ham, pork, or spam) for the ground beef.
ingredients: 1  green onion, sliced, white and green parts separated
1 tablespoon gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste), or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Heat canola oil in large skillet over high heat
Stir ground beef and white parts of green onion into skillet and reduce heat to medium
Cook and stir beef and green onion until meat is browned and onion is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Stir kimchi and gochujang into meat mixture and cook until warmed through and fragrant, 2 to 4 minutes
Add rice; cook and stir until rice is heated through and coated with gochujang, 3 to 5 minutes more
Drizzle sesame oil over rice mixture and stir to coat
Garnish with green parts of green onion
Melt 1 teaspoon butter in a skillet over medium-high heat
Crack egg into the pan and cook until white is completely set and yolk is thick, 3 to 4 minutes
